definitions.text: activity directed toward making or doing something
examples: she checked several points needing further work

definitions.text: a product produced or accomplished through the effort or activity or agency of a person or thing
examples: it is not regarded as one of his more memorable works
the symphony was hailed as an ingenious work
he was indebted to the pioneering work of John Dewey
the work of an active imagination
erosion is the work of wind or water over time

definitions.text: the occupation for which you are paid
examples: he is looking for employment
a lot of people are out of work

definitions.text: applying the mind to learning and understanding a subject (especially by reading)
examples: mastering a second language requires a lot of work
no schools offer graduate study in interior design

definitions.text: (physics) a manifestation of energy; the transfer of energy from one physical system to another expressed as the product of a force and the distance through which it moves a body in the direction of that force
examples: work equals force times distance

definitions.text: a place where work is done
examples: he arrived at work early today

definitions.text: the total output of a writer or artist (or a substantial part of it)
examples: he studied the entire Wagnerian oeuvre
Picasso's work can be divided into periods

definitions.text: exert oneself by doing mental or physical work for a purpose or out of necessity
examples: I will work hard to improve my grades
she worked hard for better living conditions for the poor

definitions.text: be employed
examples: Is your husband working again?
My wife never worked
Do you want to work after the age of 60?
She never did any work because she inherited a lot of money
She works as a waitress to put herself through college

definitions.text: have an effect or outcome; often the one desired or expected
examples: The voting process doesn't work as well as people thought
How does your idea work in practice?
This method doesn't work
The breaks of my new car act quickly
The medicine works only if you take it with a lot of water

definitions.text: perform as expected when applied
examples: The washing machine won't go unless it's plugged in
Does this old car still run well?
This old radio doesn't work anymore

definitions.text: shape, form, or improve a material
examples: work stone into tools
process iron
work the metal

definitions.text: give a workout to
examples: Some parents exercise their infants
My personal trainer works me hard
work one's muscles
this puzzle will exercise your mind

definitions.text: proceed along a path
examples: work one's way through the crowd
make one's way into the forest

definitions.text: operate in a certain place, area, or specialty
examples: She works the night clubs
The salesman works the Midwest
This artist works mostly in acrylics

definitions.text: proceed towards a goal or along a path or through an activity
examples: work your way through every problem or task
She was working on her second martini when the guests arrived
Start from the bottom and work towards the top

definitions.text: move in an agitated manner
examples: His fingers worked with tension

definitions.text: cause to happen or to occur as a consequence
examples: I cannot work a miracle
wreak havoc
bring comments
play a joke
The rain brought relief to the drought-stricken area

definitions.text: cause to work
examples: he is working his servants hard

definitions.text: prepare for crops
examples: Work the soil
cultivate the land

definitions.text: behave in a certain way when handled
examples: This dough does not work easily
The soft metal works well

definitions.text: have and exert influence or effect
examples: The artist's work influenced the young painter
She worked on her friends to support the political candidate

definitions.text: operate in or through
examples: Work the phones

definitions.text: cause to operate or function
examples: This pilot works the controls
Can you work an electric drill?

definitions.text: provoke or excite
examples: The rock musician worked the crowd of young girls into a frenzy

definitions.text: gratify and charm, usually in order to influence
examples: the political candidate worked the crowds

definitions.text: make something, usually for a specific function
examples: She molded the rice balls carefully
Form cylinders from the dough
shape a figure
Work the metal into a sword

definitions.text: move into or onto
examples: work the raisins into the dough
the student worked a few jokes into his presentation
work the body onto the flatbed truck

definitions.text: make uniform
examples: knead dough
work the clay until it is soft

definitions.text: use or manipulate to one's advantage
examples: He exploit the new taxation system
She knows how to work the system
he works his parents for sympathy

definitions.text: find the solution to (a problem or question) or understand the meaning of
examples: did you solve the problem?
Work out your problems with the boss
this unpleasant situation isn't going to work itself out
did you get it?
Did you get my meaning?
He could not work the math problem

definitions.text: cause to undergo fermentation
examples: We ferment the grapes for a very long time to achieve high alcohol content
The vintner worked the wine in big oak vats

definitions.text: go sour or spoil
examples: The milk has soured
The wine worked
The cream has turned--we have to throw it out

definitions.text: arrive at a certain condition through repeated motion
examples: The stitches of the hem worked loose after she wore the skirt many times
